name: DubsTech Datathon 2025
description: Created a website that analyzes customer service requests using interactive data visualizations (3D line plot, animated bar chart, and heatmap) to reveal trends in request distribution across the city of Seattle

name: 3D Printer G-code Simulator
description: Real-time visualization tool for Marlin-based printers using C# and Unity 3D. Implemented hot-end movement simulation using vector paths and linear interpolation.

name: Deployment Asistant - CSSE Capstone
description: A PowerShell application to streamline the deployment of Windows computers. Automates tasks such as connecting to the active directory, installing software, and updating the OS.

name: Content-Based Image Retreival System
description: Python application that uses intensity & color-code methods to analyze image features. Utilized Gaussian normalization and Manhattan distance for precise image comparison.

name: Best Buy Stock Alerts
description: A Java application that automatically alerts you via SMS and email upon restock of any Best Buy product.

name: FBLA Coding & Programming 2022
description: Placed 4th at the national Future Leadership Conference with a website designed to locate tourism activites and emergency services. Utilized Google Places API's for querying and map

name: FBLA Coding & Programming 2021
description: Placed 2nd at WA state Future Business Leadership conference. Developed a Java application that randomly generated a quiz from questions stored in a SQL database. Enables user to export their quiz results as a PDF.

name: FBLA Coding & Programming 2020
description: Placed 2nd at WA state Future Business Leadership conference. Developed a Java application that tracked student community service hours and features the ability to print hours and awards.

name: Shoot Hoops VR
description: A freethrow Basketball game created in Unity 3D. Uses the Unity XR toolkit and is compatible with all modern VR headsets.

name: Snake Game
description: High school programming class final project coded in Java and uses the Swing GUI toolkit.
